mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-17, lower shelf|surface
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Jenny [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Partially obscured by books on shelf: declaration of love. Also partially obscured by books: declaration of desire to be loved, responded to by another graffiti proclaiming that author of first graffiti is loved. Another graffiti expressing despair at life never ending. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
I [love] TO | nt to be loved | You are loved! | Why does it never end?
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Love
Despair
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
